turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about List of British flags.
turn.1: What is meant by List of British flags?
turn.2: List of British flags This list includes flags that either have been in use or are currently used by the United Kingdom, British Overseas Territories and the Crown dependencies.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The College of Arms is the authority on the flying of flags in England, Wales and Northern Ireland and maintains the only official register of flags for these countries.
turn.5: When was the College of Arms formed?
turn.6: It was established in 1484 and as part of the Royal Household operates under the authority of the Crown.
turn.7: Is the College of Arms responsible for flying the British flags?
turn.8: The Lord Lyon King of Arms holds a similar role within Scotland.
turn.9: Is the Flag Institute responsible for maintaining the list of British flags?
turn.10: A separate private body called the Flag Institute, financed by its own membership, also maintains a registry of United Kingdom flags that it styles 'the UK Flag Registry', though this has no official status under UK law.
turn.11: What is the status of British flags?
turn.12: Certain classes of flag enjoy a special status within English planning law and can be flown without needing the planning permission normally required for advertisements.
